pr_title: refactor: correct optionals and remove empties from query plans

timeline.message:
refactor: correct optionals and remove empties from query plans

This commit cleans up some properties that are marked both `required` and of type `Optional`, and others that are collections that are `required` but can be empty, in the types used to create ksqlDB's execution plans.

These changes remove a lot of noise from the plans, e.g. properties set to `null` or to empty collections `[]` and `{}`.

The saved historical plans have not be re-written. These changes will only be applied going forward and are backwards compatible.

timeline.bodyText: Removed include = As.PROPERTY as that's the default.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText: This configures Jackson to exclude null, Optional.empty() and empty collections when serializing.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText: Removed include = As.PROPERTY as that's the default.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText:
Removed required as its acceptable for this set to be empty, (it generally is).
When empty, it is no longer serialized to the JSON, hence it is now Optional.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText: No longer required, as set on the ObjectMapper.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText: No longer required, as set on the ObjectMapper.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates
big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText:
Inlined these as it means:

Don't need to add new accessors here when new accessors are added to either TestCaseSpecNode or TestCasePlanNode, i.e. cleaner, more stable API.
Makes it easier to access TestCaseSpecNode or TestCasePlanNode from the rewriter code.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.message: chore: fix tests by ALWAYS including config values
